Name: Wooden headrest
Description: Finely carved, plain wooden head-rest composed of two pieces, the base and the curved neck-support. Head-rests are common in elite burials from the Old to the New Kingdoms. As in other parts of Africa and in Japan, the head-rest was preferred to the pillow, as a means of supporting the neck and head during sleep. The excellent condition of this item indicates that it was found in an intact burial.
